Description.div:
The shipment to be changed. If Action is Modify or Delete, the shipment must be identified. Pass ShipmentKey or pass ShipmentNo, ShipNode and SellerOrganizationCode to identify the shipment.
In the scenario when one or more shipment lines with different information passed to the API, the order release information from the first available ShipmentLine will be used to derive the Shipment header attributes.

Indicates the action to be perfomed on the shipment. If Action is Modify, Cancel or Delete, pass ShipmentKey or ShipmentNo, ShipNode and SellerOrganizationCode to identify the shipment.
Default: Create-Modify
Valid Values: Create, Modify, Create-Modify, Delete, Cancel.
If Action is Cancel then except for Shipment and ShipmentLines all related entities are deleted. Shipment status moves to Cancelled (9000) and all the ShipmentLines' quantity becomes 0.
Action is Create and record already exists
If Action is Modify and record does not exist
Only Shipments without ShipmentLines can be deleted.
Once a shipment is invoiced, it cannot be cancelled.

Pass as Y if removed quantity should be backordered.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Specify if removed quantity needs to be cancelled.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
If the BackOrderRemovedQuantity flag is passed as Y , this flag is ignored.

Specify if shipment needs to be cancelled when all shipment lines have zero quantity.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Validation.Condition: If CarrierSortLocationId is not void and not a valid location in the Shipnode.

Description.div: When DoNotMixEnterprisesInLoad is set to Y and rule ALLOW_ADDITION_OF_SHIPMENT_NA_YANTRA_TO_LOAD is enabled, system will NOT mix shipments belonging to different enterprises in a load.

Pass as Y to generate a VICS standard BolNo. It is generated if BolNo is void using the Shipnode's UCCPrefix defined in YFS_Organization table, a one up sequence number and checkdigit computed using modulo 10 algorithm.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Attribute.Name: ManifestNo
Attribute.Description: An attribute used to store manifest number assigned by carrier server. ManifestNo on Shipment is just a reference attribute pointing to manifest data maintained in an external system. It is not related to the manifesting process in the system.

Description.div:
Pass as Y to overrides the statuses of shipment that can be considered for various modifications.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

If OverrideReceivingNode is set to Y then system allows user to pass receiving nodes different from receiving nodes defined on the release line during changeShipment call. The node passed must be a valid node.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
Each Shipment has a ProfileID which is derived based on its attributes.
If changed so that CarrierType changes from PARCEL to LTLorTL then a Load is created for the shipment.

Validation.Condition: If changed and shipment is included in a load taking it to its destination.

Error.Description: Cannot modify Shipment's carrier information after it has been included in a Load.

Description.div:
If equals Y then for Shipment with Containers without contents IsPackProcessComplete on the shipment is computed
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
ShipmentPackComplete equals Y then Shipment must require container without contents.

Validation.Condition: If ShipmentSortLocationId is not void and not a valid location in the Shipnode.

Description.div: If passed then it is not computed by the API else it is computed using the unit volume of Items corresponding to the shipment lines.

If passed then it is not computed by the API else it is computed using the unit weights of Orderlines corresponding to the shipment lines when Order exists on system and using the unit weights of the Items when Order does not exist on system.

For sales and transfer orders, if SIM is enabled and there is a shipment line quantity change, pick requests are also updated. Pass this flag as N if pick request updates are not required.
Default: Y
Valid Values: Y or N

This element is not needed if Shipment/CarrierServiceCode and Shipment/SCAC are passed in the Shipment header or those elements are passed in any of the Order, OrderRelease orOrderLine associated with the Shipment. If the element ScacAndService is passed, it should point to a SCAC and Service on the system. ScacAndService is used to set default values for /Shipment/SCAC and /Shipment/CarrierServiceCode.
The billing address of the shipment.

This table stores relevant personal information and addresses. Addresses are typically organization address, ship node address, customer address, and so forth. Personal information is required in cases where person to person contact needs to be established; for example, taking appointments or speaking during negotiations. The key of this table is posted in various tables to allow access to people and address information.
The Order Available On System flag in the configurator shipping preference screen determines whether the person info record should be inserted or updated. When enabled, person info record will not be inserted nor updated and the MarkForAddress will not be stamp on the shipment record. Otherwise, changeShipment will update both MarkforAddress on the shipment record as well as the person info record.

Validation.Condition: If as a result of processing Containers any Container of the Shipment gets created, modified or deleted and Shipnode is WMS node integrated with DCM.

Error.Description: Cannot use this API for processing Container or its details when Shipnode is a WMS node integrated with DCM

Description.div:
Indicates if information in the database must be replaced by the Containers information passed.
Default: N
Valid Values:
Y - Replaces all existing Containers and their instructions in the database with the values passed in the input XML. Any new Containers passed in the XML are created. Existing Containers are deleted if they are not passed in the input XML, or modified with the attributes passed in the XML.
N - Any new Containers passed in the XML are created. Existing Containers are modified. Existing Containers that are in the database and not passed in the input XML are not changed.

ShipmentContainerKey or ContainerNo attribute must be passed. The Action of Delete deletes the Container. If a Container already exists, it is modified, and if it does not exist, it is created.
If a ParentContainerNo is passed, it must already exist in the database, or parent container details must also be passed in the input.
If a Container being deleted is a parent container, then the ParentContainerNo in all the child containers is reset to blank.
The ActualFreightCharge of the shipment is computed from the ActualFreightCharge of all the containers.

Indicates the action that can be perfomed on the shipment container.
Default: Create-Modify
Valid values: Create, Delete, Create-Modify

An unique number which helps identify the shipper as well as the goods.
Not a unique value in the YFS_SHIPMENT_CONTAINER table.

Validation.Condition: If as a result of processing ContainerDetails any ContainerDetail gets created, modified or deleted and Shipnode is WMS node integrated with DCM.

Error.Description: Cannot use this API for processing Container or its details when Shipnode is a WMS node integrated with DCM

Description.div:
Indicates if information in the database must be replaced by the ContainerDetails passed.
Default: N
Valid Values:
Y - Replaces all existing ContainerDetails in the database with the values passed in the input XML. Any new ContainerDetails passed in the XML are created. Existing ContainerDetails are deleted if they are not passed in the input XML, or modified with the attributes passed in the XML.
N - Any new ContainerDetails passed in the XML are created. Existing ContainerDetails are modified with the attributes passed in the XML. Existing ContainerDetails that are in the database and not passed in the input XML are not changed.

Stores information about containerized shipment lines. ContainerDetails are created using packShipment or changeShipment. To identify the ContainerDetail, pass ContainerDetailsKey, or ShipmentLineKey attribute or ShipmentLine element.

Indicates the action that can be perfomed on the container details.
Default: Create-Modify
Valid values: Create, Delete, Create-Modify

Validation.Condition: If as a result of processing ShipmentTagSerials any ShipmentTagSerial gets created, modified or deleted and Shipnode is WMS node integrated with DCM.

Error.Description: Cannot use this API for processing Container or its details when Shipnode is a WMS node integrated with DCM

Description.div:
Indicates if information in the database must be replaced by the ShipmentTagSerials passed.
Default: N
Valid Values:
Y - Replaces all existing ShipmentTagSerials in the database with the values passed in the input XML. Any new ShipmentTagSerials passed in the XML are created. Existing ShipmentTagSerials are deleted if they are not passed in the input XML, or modified with the attributes passed in the XML.
N - Any new ShipmentTagSerials passed in the XML are created. Existing ShipmentTagSerials are modified with the attributes passed in the XML. Existing ShipmentTagSerials that are in the database and not passed in the input XML are not changed.

Additional information related to tag number, serial number, ship by date for a shipment line or container detail is stored in this table. If the shipment line item is tagged, ShipmentTagSerial has to be specified to confirm the shipment. To identify the ShipmentTagSerial pass ShipmentTagSerialKey, or SerialNo, or ShipByDate or Tag Attributes: LotNumber, LotKeyReference, ManufacturingDate, LotAttribute1, LotAttribute2, LotAttribute3, BatchNo, RevisionNo. Tag information is stored only if the Node tracks tag information in inventory or the Buyer mandates tag information.
When sum of tagged quantity of the line and containerized quantity is greater than ShipmentLine quantity.
When total tagged quantity for the Container detail is greater than Container detail quantity .
When tag details are not given for the entire quantity of a shipment line with item as tag controlled.
When tag details are not given for shipment line with item as tag controlled.

Indicates the action that can be perfomed on the Shipment Tag Serial.
Default: Create-Modify
Valid values: Create, Delete, Create-Modify

Serial number.
If RequestedSerialNo in ShipmentLine is not void and does not equal SerialNo.
If SerialNo is provided and Quantity is not equal to one.

Ship advice number of the order release. ShipAdviceNo will only be used when order release identifiers such as OrderReleaseKey or ReleaseNo and OrderHeaderKey are not provided. ShipAdviceNo and ShipNode (if provided) will be used to determine the order release in the system. If more than one order releases are found in the system with the same ShipAdviceNo and ShipNode (if provided), the order release with a pickable status will be used.
More than one order releases in a pickable status are found with the same ShipAdviceNo and ShipNode (if provided).
System cannot find an order release with the provided ShipAdviceNo and ShipNode (if provided).

Indicates if information in the database must be replaced by the Instructions information passed.
Default: N
Valid Values:
Y - Replaces all existing Instructions with the values passed in the input XML. Any new Instructions passed in the XML are created. Existing Instructions are deleted if they are not passed in the input XML, or modified with the attributes passed in the XML.
N - Any new Instructions passed in the XML are created. Existing Instructions are modified with the attributes passed in the XML. Existing Instructions that are in the database and not passed in the input XML are not changed.

The InstructionDetailKey attribute or InstructionType and SequenceNo attributes must be passed. Related shipment instructions are stored in this table. To identify the Instruction pass InstructionDetailKey, or InstructionType and SequenceNo.

Indicates the action that can be perfomed on the container instruction detail.
Default: Create-Modify
Valid values: Create, Delete, Create-Modify

Indicates if information in the database must be replaced by the Instructions information passed.
Default: N
Valid Values:
Y - Replaces all existing Instructions with the values passed in the input XML. Any new Instructions passed in the XML are created. Existing Instructions are deleted if they are not passed in the input XML, or modified with the attributes passed in the XML.
N - Any new Instructions passed in the XML are created. Existing Instructions are modified with the attributes passed in the XML. Existing Instructions that are in the database and not passed in the input XML are not changed.

The InstructionDetailKey attribute or InstructionType and SequenceNo attributes must be passed. Related shipment instructions are stored in this table. To identify the Instruction pass InstructionDetailKey, or InstructionType and SequenceNo.

Indicates the action that can be perfomed on the container instruction detail.
Default: Create-Modify
Valid values: Create, Delete, Create-Modify

Attribute.Name: Tranname
Attribute.Description: Specifies the name of the Transaction

Description.div:
OrderRelease information is passed and OrderAvailableOnSystem is N .
Stores releases made against an order. To create Shipment for the complete Release quantity, pass the OrderReleases/OrderRelease. Do not also pass -ShipmentLines/ShipmentLine node if you are passing this node. To identify the OrderRelease, pass either OrderReleaseKey or ReleaseNo and either OrderHeaderKey or the Order element or ShipAdviceNo. All of the OrderReleases passed in the input XML must belong to same ShipNode and SellerOrganizationCode.

Indicates an association action between shipment and order release.
Default: Add
Valid values: Add

Ship advice number of the order release. ShipAdviceNo will only be used when order release identifiers such as OrderReleaseKey or ReleaseNo and OrderHeaderKey are not provided. ShipAdviceNo and ShipNode (if provided) will be used to determine the order release in the system. If more than one order releases are found in the system with the same ShipAdviceNo and ShipNode (if provided), the order release with a pickable status will be used.
More than one order releases in a pickable status are found with the same ShipAdviceNo and ShipNode (if provided).
System cannot find an order release with the provided ShipAdviceNo and ShipNode (if provided).

Indicates if information in the database must be replaced by the ShipmentLines information passed.
Default: N
Valid Values:
Y - Replaces all existing ShipmentLines and their instructions in the database with the values passed in the input XML. Any new ShipmentLines passed in the XML are created. Existing ShipmentLines are deleted if they are not passed in the input XML, or modified with the attributes passed in the XML.
N - Any new ShipmentLines passed in the XML are created. Existing ShipmentLines are modified with the attributes passed in the XML. Existing ShipmentLines that are in the database and not passed in the input XML are not changed.

Pass information in this ShipmentLine element to create shipment for a partial order release quantity. Do not pass any information under OrderReleases/OrderRelease element if passing the ShipmentLines/ShipmentLine element. To identify the ShipmentLine, pass ShipmentLineKey.

Indicates the action that can be perfomed on the shipment line.
Default: Create-Modify
Valid values: Create, Delete, Cancel, Create-Modify
If Action is Delete or Cancel and there are any open tasks associated with the ShipmentLine then the tasks are cancelled.
If Action is Cancel then Quantity reduces to 0.
Actions Create, Delete and Cancel are not allowed once a shipment is invoiced.

The number of components required for one kit. The quantity is used only for bundle components only when the order is not available for the shipment line. When order is available for the shipment line, KitQty is defaulted from order information.
If Quantity is reduced and there are any open tasks associated with the ShipmentLine then the tasks' quantity is reduced.
Requested Serial Number of the item. If order is available on the system, the SerialNo is defaulted from SerialNo of the corresponding order line.

Ship advice number of the order release. ShipAdviceNo will only be used when order release identifiers such as OrderReleaseKey or ReleaseNo and OrderHeaderKey are not provided. ShipAdviceNo and ShipNode (if provided) will be used to determine the order release in the system. If more than one order releases are found in the system with the same ShipAdviceNo and ShipNode (if provided), the order release with a pickable status will be used.
More than one order releases in a pickable status are found with the same ShipAdviceNo and ShipNode (if provided).
System cannot find an order release with the provided ShipAdviceNo and ShipNode (if provided).

Identifies the bundle parent shipment line for this line. This element will be considered only when order is not available on system for the shipment. When order is available on system the hierarchy of the bundle is obtained from order information.
When order is not available on system and bundle item is passed without any components, then the bundle components will be defaulted from catalog.
When the passed shipment line attributes fails to identify a bundle shipment line.
When bundle components are not passed or present for the bundle parent item.

Action to perform
Valid Values:
Create - To add a component to already existing bundle.
A non-bundle parent line cannot be specified as bundle parent line.
Delete - To remove a component from a bundle.
A bundle parent line must have at least one component.
Shipment Line key of the bundle parent line. Alternatively ShipmentLineNo can be passed.
Shipment Line number of the bundle parent line. Alternatively ShipmentLineKey can be passed.
Information related to requested tag details for the shipment line. To identify the ShipmentLineInvAttRequest pass the Tag Unique Attributes: LotNumber, BatchNo, RevisionNo.

Indicates if information in the database must be replaced by the ShipmentTagSerials passed.
Default: N
Valid Values:
Y - Replaces all existing ShipmentTagSerials in the database with the values passed in the input XML. Any new ShipmentTagSerials passed in the XML are created. Existing ShipmentTagSerials are deleted if they are not passed in the input XML, or modified with the attributes passed in the XML.
N - Any new ShipmentTagSerials passed in the XML are created. Existing ShipmentTagSerials are modified with the attributes passed in the XML. Existing ShipmentTagSerials that are in the database and not passed in the input XML are not changed.

Stores additional information related to tag number, serial number, ship by date for a shipment line or container detail. Tag information is stored only if the Node tracks tag information in inventory or the Buyer mandates tag information.

Indicates the action that can be perfomed on the shipment tag serial.
Default: Create-Modify
Valid values: Create, Delete, Modify

Indicates if information in the database must be replaced by the Instructions information passed.
Default: N
Valid Values:
Y - Replaces all existing Instructions with the values passed in the input XML. Any new Instructions passed in the XML are created. Existing Instructions are deleted if they are not passed in the input XML, or modified with the attributes passed in the XML.
N - Any new Instructions passed in the XML are created. Existing Instructions are modified with the attributes passed in the XML. Existing Instructions that are in the database and not passed in the input XML are not changed.

Indicates if information in the database must be replaced by the ShipmentCharges information passed.
Default: N
Valid Values:
Y - Replaces all existing ShipmentCharges and their instructions in the database with the values passed in the input XML. Any new ShipmentCharges passed in the XML are created. Existing ShipmentCharges are deleted if they are not passed in the input XML, or modified with the attributes passed in the XML.
N - Any new ShipmentCharges passed in the XML are created. Existing ShipmentCharges are modified with the attributes passed in the XML. Existing ShipmentCharges that are in the database and not passed in the input XML are not changed.

To identify the ShipmentCharge, pass either LoadShipmentChargeKey or all of the following attributes:
ChargeCategory, ChargeName, PayeeOrganizationCode, KeyReference1, KeyReference2.
The Shipment's TotalActualCharge of is updated with the sum of all the ActualCharge values. The Shipment's TotalEstimatedCharge is updated with the sum of all the EstimatedCharge values.

Indicates the action that can be perfomed on the load shipment charges.
Default: Create-Modify
Valid values: Create, Delete, Create-Modify

Indicates if information in the database must be replaced by the AdditionalDates information passed.
Default: N
Valid Values:
Y - Replaces all existing AdditionalDates and their instructions in the database with the values passed in the input XML. Any new AdditionalDates passed in the XML are created. Existing AdditionalDates are deleted if they are not passed in the input XML, or modified with the attributes passed in the XML.
N - Any new AdditionalDates passed in the XML are created. Existing AdditionalDates are modified with the attributes passed in the XML. Existing AdditionalDates that are in the database and not passed in the input XML are unchanged: they are neither deleted or modified.

Stores additional date attributes for the shipment. DateTypeId must be passed.
AdditionalDate is used to override dates that were calculated for the Shipment, and occur in the Shipment node. For example, by setting the DateTypeId to SCHEDULE , and passing a value for RequestedDate, the value of RequestedShipmentDate for the Shipment is ignored, and the value in AdditionalDate is used.

Indicates the action that can be perfomed on the additional dates associated with the shipment.
Default: Create-Modify
Valid values: Create, Delete, Create-Modify
ShipmentStatusAudit will be considered only while creating or cancelling Shipment.

Attribute.Name: StatusDate
Attribute.Description: Date and time of the status change.

Element.Description: Should be specified only when Order does not exist on system.

Description.div:
Indicates the action that can be perfomed on the Special Service associated with the shipment.
Default: Create-Modify
Valid values: Create, Delete
Action is Create and OrderAvailableOnSystem flag is Y
If SpecialService is getting modified.

Error.Description: Special service code does not exist.

Description.div: When this is passed for Shipments where OrderAvailableOnSystem=N or OrderAvailableOnSystem=M, the Shipment's Pro Forma Invoices, if any exists, will all be deleted. Each child OrderInvoice XML node will be used to internally invoke the recordInvoiceCreation API to create a Pro Forma Invoice. None of this is applicable for Shipments where OrderAvailableOnSystem=Y and will be ignored.

When this is passed for Shipments where OrderAvailableOnSystem=N or OrderAvailableOnSystem=M, it will be used to internally invoke the recordInvoiceCreation API to create a Pro Forma Invoice. This is not applicable for Shipments where OrderAvailableOnSystem=Y and will be ignored.

Contains data related to an order invoice line.
OrderLineKey must be passed and must be valid.
Quantity being invoiced.
UOM on which all the transactional quantities are specified.
Optional. Stores hold type information. Multiple HoldTypes can be applied/ removed for a single shipment.

The code identifying the hold type to be applied/ removed for a Shipment.
HoldType must be defined in the configuration

This attribute specifies the status of the shipment hold type.
Valid Values:
1100 - To apply a HoldType to shipment.
1200 - To reject a HoldType from shipment.
1300 - To resolve a HoldType from shipment.
Default: Hold type is always created in '1100' status.
